Class ebook

[line 21]

Location: /ebook.php




Remarks


This is the primary class intented for general use. This class uses the open ebook reader and the open  ebook writter classes. If you wish to only read or write you can use the single libary insted of this  combined one. This class is only intended to make it easier to see and use the reader and writter, There  should only be calls to functions from reader or writter here.






Class Variable Summary



    
		






Class Constant Summary



    
	






Inherited Class Constant Summary







Inherited Class Variable Summary

    ebook::addContentFile
    


    
addContentFile(
$fileLoc
$fileLoc, $subDir
$name, $name
$mime, [$mime
$subDir = null], [$fallBackId
$fallBackId = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $fileLoc
    
		
    Where is the file currently located.
    
			
    $name
    
		
    If you want the file in a subdirectory of the content folder.
    
			
    $mime
    
		
    Short discriptive name of what the content item is. eg: Chapter 3.
    
			
    $subDir
    
		
    the mime type of the file being added.
    
			
    $fallBackId
    
		
    the id of an item you wish to use as a fallback item.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    true if the file was added successfully and false if not.
    

    Remarks
    

    This is used for adding content files to an epub. Make sure you have write permission to the  destination directory.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    ebook::buildEPUB
    


    
buildEPUB(
$name
$name, $dest
$dest );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $name
    
		
    The name you want the epub file to have. Don't include a file extenshion.
    
			
    $dest
    
		
    The location you want the final epub file.
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Puts together the eBook and places it in the desired directory.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    ebook::getContentFile
    


    
getContentFile(
$location
$location );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $location
    
		
    Where inside of the epub is the file you want
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    string of the contents of the requested file.
    

    Remarks
    

    Will give you the requested file out of the epub
    

    Note: When finding files based on the manifest's href attribute, the file locations are  relative to where the opf file is all ready located in the file structure. So if the opf file  is at /ops/contnet.opf and your image is at /ops/img/wolf.jpg then your manifest href for that  image will read /img/wolf.jpg. Use basename(getFilePath("opf")); for the directories leading to the OPF file.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]

    ebook::setDcContributor
    


    
setDcContributor(
$contributor
$contributor, [$index
$index = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $contributor
    
		
    The contributor to be set. If you want set more then one contributor send an array into this parameter.
    
			
    $index
    
		
    if there is more then one instance of this item, specify it and that item will be edited.
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Sets the contributor. Multiple instances are permitted.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public

    ebook::setDcContributorAttrib
    


    
setDcContributorAttrib(
$attrib
$attrib, $attribValue
$attribValue, [$index
$index = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $attrib
    
		
    The name of the optional attributes to be set. Optional attributes are, Role, XmlLang, OpfFileAs.
    
			
    $attribValue
    
		
    The value to be set for the optional attribute. If you want set more then one contributor attribute send  an array into this parameter. Make sure the attributes corresponde the appropriate contributor index
    
			
    $index
    
		
    if there is more then one instance of this item, specify it and that item will be edited.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    if set or false if not.
    

    Remarks
    

    Sets the optional contributor attributes.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]

    ebook::setDcRelationAttrib
    


    
setDcRelationAttrib(
$attrib
$attrib, $attribValue
$attribValue, [$index
$index = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $attrib
    
		
    The name of the optional attributes to be set. Optional attributes are XmlLang.
    
			
    $attribValue
    
		
    The value to be set for the optional attribute. If you want set more then one relation attribute send  an array into this parameter. Make sure the attributes corresponde the appropriate relation index
    
			
    $index
    
		
    if there is more then one instance of this item, specify it and that item will be edited.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    if set or false if not.
    

    Remarks
    

    Set the optional relation attributes.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]

    ebook::setGuide
    


    
setGuide(
$title
$title, $type
$type, $href
$href, [$index
$index = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $title
    
		
    Name of the guide item.
    
			
    $type
    
		
    The required type attribute describes the publication component referenced by the href  attribute. Type should be of this list cover, title-page, toc "table of contents", index "back-of-book  style index", glossary, acknowledgements, bibliography, colophon, copyright-page, dedication, epigraph,  foreword, loi "list of illustrations", lot "list of tables", notes, and preface.
    
			
    $href
    
		
    location of the guide item.
    
			
    $index
    
		
    The index number of the guide item to be set.
    
		
    Remarks
    

    sets the guide item desired. Arrays can be sent into the attributes to set more then one  guide item at a time. The guide element identifies fundamental structural components of the publication,  to enable Reading Systems to provide convenient access to them.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    ebook::setSpine
    


    
setSpine(
$spineId
$spineId );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $spineId
    
		
    Send an array of ID names as they appear in the manifest in the order you want them read.
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Sets a desired spine order. The spine is used to determine the reading order.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    ebook::setSpineToc
    


    
setSpineToc(
$toc
$toc );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $toc
    
		
    The manifest item that is the table of contents.
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Used to tell the spine what manifest item is the Table Of Contents. This does not need to  be set, this is optional.
    
	
    access
